intro: Monechma marginatum, commonly known as the marginated monechma, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinctive margin that is usually pale or whitish. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the dry season.
